botanical_details.potentially_harmful: The seeds may cause mild stomach upsets if ingested. Wear gloves and wash hands after handling
botanical_details.genus: Pyracantha are evergreen shrubs or small trees, with spiny branches bearing simple leaves and corymbs of small white flowers followed by showy red, orange or yellow berries

how_to_grow.cultivation: Easy to grow in fertile soil in sun or partial shade. Best sheltered from cold drying winds
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by semi-ripe cuttings from late-spring onwards or propagate by seed. Extract seeds from berries in autumn, sow and keep in cold frame. Seeds need about three months of cold stratification before they germinate.
how_to_grow.pruning: Pruning group 1. On wall-trained plants after flowering in mid-summer, shorten lateral shoots to 2-3 leaves from the base to expose the developing berries
how_to_grow.pests: Can get aphids, woolly aphid, caterpillars, brown scale and leaf-mining moths
how_to_grow.diseases: May be affected by fireblight and scab
